articles.title: Innovative New Samsung Neo QLED 8K TV is Now Available
articles.author: Jessica Fritsch
articles.summary: The 65″ Class Neo QLED 8K QN900F Vision AI Smart TV is now available. It has a screen resolution of 7,680 x 4,320 and anti-glare technology. It is part of the NeoQLED series and features a 65″ screen size with a diagonal measurement of 64.5″.

articles.title: Israeli startup AutonomyAI raises millions turning AI into full-time developers
articles.author: JERUSALEM POST STAFF
articles.summary: "AutonomyAI represents a fundamental change in how organizations use artificial intelligence," Gilad Shany, investor and Managing Partner at ION Crossover, explains.   Sign up for the Business & Innovation Newsletter to get the latest news on AutonomyAI.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence transforms patient care and reduces burnout, physician says
articles.author: Kennedy Hayes
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is transforming the way doctors interact with their patients. Ambient listening technology listens to conversations between doctors and patients, creates real-time transcriptions and compiles detailed clinical notes without disrupting the flow of the appointment. 600 healthcare organizations are using the technology in Colorado, Illinois, Massachusetts, Texas and Pennsylvania.

articles.title: AI application tackles literacy challenges with audio summaries
articles.author: Megan Sayles
articles.summary: K.C. and Jayne Hopson are the owners of ZingFrogai, a technology company that uses artificial intelligence to convert written content into short audio and text summaries called, 'zings'. The platform converts lengthy articles and blog posts into an audio clip and text summary that can be listened to or read in less than a minute. The first zing launched on the website of The Baltimore Times in December 2023.

articles.title: Opt AI only if you have flair for it
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: A degree in Artificial Intelligence (AI) is one of the most sought-after degrees in the world of technology. AI can be used to build robots, create smart assistants, or develop apps that 'think' on their own. It's becoming more and more popular than before.

articles.title: California's El Camino Health implements AI, robots in hospitals to improve efficiency
articles.author: Nollyanne Delacruz
articles.summary: El Camino Health operates hospitals in Los Gatos and Mountain View, California, and several urgent care clinics throughout Santa Clara County. It has implemented a deterioration index, which monitors a patient's vital signs and predicts when they change and sends someone to check on them. An algorithm predicts which patients are most at risk for falling and allows nurses to intervene with those patients to prevent falls or reduce them from happening. The radiology department also received a technological boost in the last year. AI is being used to analyze X-rays with an initial reading and can also pick up on incidental findings.

articles.title: California's El Camino Health implements AI, robots in hospitals to improve efficiency
articles.author: Nollyanne Delacruz
articles.summary: Robots are helping to deliver medications and take samples to the laboratory at El Camino Health's hospitals in Los Gatos and Mountain View, California, and several urgent care clinics throughout Santa Clara County. They are among the new technologies implemented to improve efficiency and allow clinicians to focus on patient care.

articles.title: Palantir Technologies Inc. (PLTR): Report Reveals Bold IRS AI Overhaul Plan with Elon Musk's DOGE Team
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ:PLTR) is a leading provider of artificial intelligence systems. Palantir is working with Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency on a major IRS project. PLTR ranks 13th on our list of AI stocks catching Wall Street's attention.

articles.title: Chinese AI tool generates, edits lifelike human actions in 3D motion
articles.author: Bojan Stojkovski
articles.summary: Researchers from Peking University's Institute for Artificial Intelligence in Beijing and the State Key Laboratory of General AI have unveiled new AI models that can simplify a range of human motions for digital characters and avatars. MotionCutMix is a training method that teaches AI to edit 3D human motions based on text input.

articles.title: Scientists map part of a mouse's brain that's so complex it looks like a galaxy
articles.author: Lauran Neergaard
articles.summary: Scientists have created the largest functional map of a brain to date. It shows the wiring connecting 84,000 neurons as they fire off messages in a mouse's brain. The data is open to scientists worldwide for additional research. It's a step toward unraveling the mystery of how our brains work.

articles.title: Scientists map part of a mouse's brain that's so complex it looks like a galaxy
articles.author: Lauran Neergaard
articles.summary: Scientists have created the largest functional map of a brain to date. It shows the wiring connecting 84,000 neurons as they fire off messages in a mouse's brain. The data is open to scientists worldwide for additional research. It's a step toward unraveling the mystery of how our brains work.

articles.title: Intuitive Machines (NasdaqGM:LUNR) Posts Positive 2025 Revenue Guidance
articles.author: Simply Wall St
articles.summary: Intuitive Machines reported a 12% increase in its share price over the past week. The company's performance was aligned with the broader upward market movement. Intuitive Machines' total shareholder returns amounted to a 51.97% increase over the last year. However, the company's financials indicate ongoing challenges, with increasing net losses even as sales grew substantially.

articles.title: Poll Finds Americans Are Largely Disgusted by AI-Generated News
articles.summary: Poynter and University of Minnesota conducted an online survey of 1,128 Americans about their opinion on artificial intelligence and journalism. Nearly half of the respondents don't want AI reporting the news to them and 20 percent think news publishers shouldn't be using it at all.

articles.title: Burt's Eye View: Too much to remember • The Malibu Times
articles.author: Burt Ross
articles.summary: Burt Ross has to remember far more information than his mind can retain. He has more passwords than there are letters in the alphabet and he doesn't store them. He hopes the new artificial intelligence will do a better job than he does. He doesn't want to alienate the AI from his natural intelligence.

articles.title: California Nuclear Plant Integrates AI for Efficiency
articles.author: Oil Price
articles.summary: California's last remaining nuclear energy plant is using artificial intelligence to make its processes more efficient. So far, AI is only being used for document retrieval, but lawmakers and lawmakers want it to be used for other processes as well, such as energy production and waste management.

articles.title: AI holds promise in scientific research, but can't substitute for humans, experts say • Michigan Advance
articles.author: Paige Gross
articles.summary: The Trump administration is making sweeping cuts to staff and research grants at science-related agencies. In February, the U.S. Department of Energy's national labs partnered with AI companies OpenAI and Anthropic for an 'AI Jam Session,' a day for 1,000 scientists to test the companies' AI models and share feedback. Last year's Nobel Prize in Chemistry was awarded to three scientists for discoveries that used AI to predict the shape of proteins and to invent new ones.

articles.title: AI Used to Predict Storm Path with 98% Accuracy in First Trial
articles.author: Jan Otte
articles.summary: In a groundbreaking first trial, artificial intelligence has achieved 98% accuracy in predicting storm paths. Weather enthusiasts and experts are buzzing with excitement over this development. Let's dive deep into the intricacies of this technological marvel.       .

articles.title: Secretary Lutnick pours cold water on tech tariff exemptions
articles.author: Todd Campbell
articles.summary: The technology sector was relieved on Saturday when President Trump said that certain industries, including semiconductors, computer hardware, and smartphones, would be exempt from the reciprocal tariffs put in place this month. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said on Sunday that the exemption may be temporary and specific sector tariffs will soon be placed upon them. The stock market's back-to-back 20% plus returns in 2023 and 2024 were largely driven by strength in America's biggest technology stocks.

articles.title: Best AI Generators: Top NSFW AI Image and Video Generators
articles.author: Violet Fawkes
articles.summary: As AI technology continues to evolve, so too must our conversations about digital ethics, and the role of desire in the virtual age. The world of NSFW AI generators is vast and fast-moving, with new platforms emerging almost weekly. Some focus on hyper-realistic image generation, while others lean into companion chatbots or interactive roleplay and storytelling.

articles.title: El Camino Health implements AI, robots in hospitals to improve efficiency
articles.author: The Mercury News
articles.summary: Robots are helping to deliver medications and take samples to the laboratory at El Camino Health. They are among the new technologies implemented to improve efficiency while allowing clinicians to focus on patient. AI models need to be trained over time with more and more data.

articles.title: Power-hungry data centers, AI change U.S. energy infrastructure outlook
articles.author: Paige Gross
articles.summary: There are more than 3,600 data centers in the U.S. and 80% of them are concentrated in 15 states. The market for data centers has doubled since 2020. Tech companies that require large amounts of computing power, the private equity firms and banks that invest in them and real estate or specialized firms are the primary funders of data centers.

articles.title: Why AI At Work Needs Humans At The Wheel
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: AI is changing how we work, but replacing people isn't the strategy. It's about redefining work so humans stay essential, empowered, and in control.       .   for more information, go to: http://www.justgiving.com/the-solution-to-redefining-work-by-automation-and-machine-intelligence/

articles.title: Artificial intelligence was hot topic at Kentucky Chamber's inaugural Healthcare Innovation Summit
articles.author: The Sentinel Echo
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence was one of the hot topics at the Kentucky Chamber of Commerce's inaugural Healthcare Innovation Summit, held Feb. 21 in Louisville.       .   for confidential support call the Samaritans on 08457 90 90 90, visit a local Samaritans branch or click here.

articles.title: Gemini Live Lets Your Phone See—And It's Both Fascinating and Creepy. Here's My Experience
articles.summary: In early 2025, Google announced a major new feature for Gemini Live: its advanced voice mode. It acts as a guide, translator, and tutor. It's spectacular how it recognizes almost anything and how quickly it identifies specific items like plant types and tech device models. It also solves equations, psycho-technical problems and explains them step by step.

articles.title: El Camino Health implements AI, robots in hospitals to improve efficiency
articles.author: Nollyanne Delacruz
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is helping doctors and nurses at El Camino Health hospitals monitor patient vital signs, detect illnesses in X-rays and draft doctor's notes and responses for patients using AI. It's also helping them draft notes for the patients' medical notes.

articles.title: A ChatGPT Screenless Phone Could Be Coming, as OpenAI Reportedly Eyes Jony Ive's AI Startup
articles.author: Samantha Kelly
articles.summary: ChatGPT maker OpenAI is looking into a potential acquisition of AI startup io Products. io Products was co-founded by Jony Ive and Sam Altman, who are working on a screenless phone concept and smart home devices. If a deal materializes, OpenAI would gain access to both the underlying technology and the core engineering team.

articles.title: The Real AI Bottleneck: Bad UX
articles.author: / Context Window
articles.summary: Shopify CEO Toby Lütke believes AI is an indispensable tool in the workplace. However, there are large gaps in AI adoption between professionals and students. Nan Yu, head of product at product management software company Linear, argues that AI adoption is a UX problem.

articles.title: Bill Gates: AI Will Eliminate Most Jobs Except For Coders, Energy Experts, & Biologists
articles.author: Tim Brown
articles.summary: Bill Gates predicts that in the next decade, advances in artificial intelligence will eliminate most jobs except for coders, energy experts and biologists. The Globalists' agenda is to monitor and control everything and everyone with AI and the Internet of Things (IoT).

articles.title: AI holds promise in scientific research, but can't substitute for humans, experts say • Iowa Capital Dispatch
articles.author: Paige Gross
articles.summary: The Trump administration is making sweeping cuts to staff and research grants at science-related agencies. In February, the U.S. Department of Energy's national labs partnered with AI companies OpenAI and Anthropic for an 'AI Jam Session,' a day for 1,000 scientists across various disciplines to test the companies' AI models and share feedback. Last year's Nobel Prize in Chemistry was awarded to three scientists for using AI to predict the shape of proteins and invent new ones.

articles.title: The AI Doctor Coming to Read Your Test Results
articles.author: John Miley
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence gets better at interpreting images, the tech industry is setting its sights on health care. Microsoft, Google and OpenAI all have AI models or research in medical imaging. Start-up Harrison.ai recently raised $112 million in funding to speed up diagnoses for radiologists.

articles.title: 10 countries with the highest concentration of AI talent globally
articles.author: Ammon
articles.summary: With the rise of artificial intelligence, companies around the world are in a race for strong AI talent. The number of AI-related jobs is on the rise, especially in the tech sector.    in the field of AI is growing rapidly. For more information, visit the company's website.

articles.title: An AI model has finally passed an authentic Turing test, scientists say
articles.author: Roland Moore-Colyer
articles.summary: Large language models (LLMs) are getting better at pretending to be human. GPT-4.5 passed the Turing test for the first time. Meta's LLaMa-3.1 also passed the test. The study was published to the arXiv preprint database.

articles.title: From GPS gaffes to fabricated facts: AI still needs a human co-pilot
articles.author: JJ Rosen
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence sometimes lies to you. In one case, a lawyer used ChatGPT to write a legal brief and the AI hallucinated several court cases. The AI world is aware of this bug and working on it. New models are being trained to check their own work, cite sources, and even say "I don't know".

articles.title: AI humanoid robot learns to mimic human emotions and behavior
articles.author: Kurt Knutsson
articles.summary: Disney Research has created a humanoid robot that can mimic human emotions and behaviors in real time. It uses advanced artificial intelligence to replicate natural gestures and deliberate actions with striking accuracy. It learns by observing and mimicking human operators who guide its emotional responses during interactions. Disney plans to use Newton to enhance its robotic character platform, which includes expressive droids like the Star Wars-inspired BDX models showcased at NVIDIA's GTC keynote this year.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence was hot topic at Kentucky Chamber's inaugural Healthcare Innovation Summit
articles.author: Janie Slaven
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence was one of the hot topics at the Kentucky Chamber of Commerce's inaugural Healthcare Innovation Summit, held Feb. 21 in Louisville. The all-day event hosted leaders from businesses, health insurance companies, hospitals, government and pharmaceutical companies to discuss the state's evolving health care landscape.

articles.title: Data Centers: Economic benefit or environmental boondoggle?
articles.author: Richard Bednarski
articles.summary: Last month, the Reno City Council approved the Oppidan Data Center to become the city's second data center. Data centers use a lot of energy and water to power artificial intelligence (AI) models like ChatGPT. According to the Sierra Club, data centers are increasing the demand for electricity, water and other resources. Nevada accounts for 80% of the nation's electrical demand for data centers.

articles.title: ChatGPT now lets users create fake images of politicians. We stress-tested it
articles.author: CBC
articles.summary: ChatGPT now comes bundled with an updated image generator. OpenAI has removed the ban on images of public figures from ChatGPT. The generator was tested to see if it could generate fake images that could deceive voters in an election. It did not work.

articles.title: AI-Generated Images Can Exploit How Your Mind Works − Here's Why They Fool You and How to Spot Them
articles.author: Arryn Robbins
articles.summary: Arryn Robbins is Assistant Professor of Psychology, University of Richmond. She is surprised that people don't notice that many images on social media are AI-generated. People's visual system isn't wired for noticing small details in AI images. People also miss things they aren't actively paying attention to or looking for. AI can influence public opinion and make false claims.

articles.title: How AI is making self-appraisals better and less painful — for both workers and managers
articles.author: Lindsay Dodgson
articles.summary: According to Microsoft's 2024 Work Trend Index, 75% of global knowledge workers are using AI in some form. Oracle implemented an AI performance review in 2023 and 89% of employees liked it. AI performance reviews can help with articulation and form statements that align with the company's business strategy and ideology.

articles.title: Balochistan CM Bugti urges AI use for better governance, youth development
articles.author: Dawn
articles.summary: Balochistan Chief Minister Sarfaraz Bugti stressed the importance of leveraging modern technology, particularly Artificial Intelligence (AI), to enhance transparency, efficiency and performance in governance, financial matters.   Â      in Quetta.

articles.title: Microsoft's AI division head wants to create a lasting relationship between chatbots and their users
articles.summary: Mustafa Suleyman is the CEO of Microsoft's artificial intelligence division. He wants to develop a new product line as integral to daily life as the software giant's past innovations. He hopes that everyone will have their own personalized AI companion.

articles.title: AI models still struggle to debug software, Microsoft study shows
articles.author: Business Ghana
articles.summary: 25% of new code at Google is generated by AI. Meta CEO Mark believes that fine-tuning AI models can make them better interactive debuggers. OpenAI, Anthropic, and other top AI labs are increasingly being used to assist with programming tasks.

articles.title: AI might be scanning your resume. Here's what job hunters should know
articles.author: Matthew Kaufman
articles.summary: According to data from Resume Genius, 48% of hiring managers report using AI to screen resumes and applications. The AI recruitment sector is expected to experience a compound annual growth rate of 6.1% between 2023 and 2030, according to the Society for Human Resources Management.

articles.title: To tell her own story, this acclaimed novelist turned to ChatGPT
articles.author: Meena Venkataramanan
articles.summary: Vauhini Vara's 'Searches: Selfhood in the Digital Age' is a hybrid memoir-essay collection. ChatGPT offers readers a summary on the book's cover. It explains how the internet and digital technologies influence and reshape personal identity, self-perception and the quest for meaning in contemporary society.

articles.title: Wasting Inferences With Aider
articles.author: Scott Werner
articles.summary: This week's "Works on My Machine" explores the 'Waste Inferences' and 'Agent Cluster' approach to automated coding. This week's demo shows an automated workflow triggered entirely by assigning an Asana task to fix a simple bug in a simple Todo app. The agent framework and trigger use the Sublayer Rubygem, an agent framework designed to make it easy to build your own AI powered devtools.

articles.title: AI can help keep kids  safe in school
articles.author: Sanje Sedera
articles.summary: Sanje Sedera works with an AI company looking to integrate its technology into schools. He works with Boolean Lab to encourage the adoption of Griffin365, an AI program designed to improve school safety. He hopes to see a future in which the threat of violence is completely eradicated from all schools nationwide.

articles.title: Light in the Dark Analytics brings companies into the digital age
articles.author: Sam Zavada
articles.summary: Paul Ascenzi started a new business Light in the Dark Analytics to help small and medium-sized businesses in Northeast Pennsylvania. He has a decade of experience in software engineering and a master's degree from Southern New Hampshire University. He will be looking for more experienced software engineers to join him.

articles.title: Business Tech News: Shopify CEO Says AI First Before Employees
articles.author: Gene Marks
articles.summary: Shopify has implemented a new hiring policy that prioritizes artificial intelligence (AI) over human hires. Procore published its report on AI and automation in the construction industry. JP Morgan discussed the transformative role of AI in retail industry at conference in Las Vegas. Toys R Us used OpenAI's platform to create a branded video.

articles.title: Learning Negotiation Skills Via Generative AI
articles.author: Lance Eliot
articles.summary: Generative AI and large language models (LLMs) can help you improve your negotiation skills. AI can provide online readings on how to negotiate and do head-to-head practices on the art and science of negotiation. It can also be used as a negotiation coach.

articles.title: Why AI At Work Needs Humans At The Wheel
articles.author: Nirit Cohen
articles.summary: In a world where everyone has access to the same AI tools, the technology itself doesn't give you an edge. What differentiates your organization is how well your people think, create, decide, and respond in ways no machine can. In a trust economy, human-centered leadership becomes a brand asset. Leaders need to account for what's responsible when AI is used.

articles.title: ‘I've had one like this on my hand for years': Woman uses ChatGPT for a palm reading. Now she's getting checked for skin cancer
articles.author: Mars Ramos
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an artificial intelligence chatbot developed by the company OpenAI. It helps people identify potential cases of melanoma. Rin is getting checked up after an AI search turned into a potential concern. Her video has over 2.5 million views as of Saturday.

articles.title: ‘I've had one like this on my hand for years': Woman uses ChatGPT for a ...
articles.author: The Daily Dot
articles.summary: Dr. ChatGPT told a person to get his mole checked because it looks like acral lentiginous melanoma, according to the palm reading he had done by AI. He is now getting checked up.    - Dr.ChatGPT.

articles.title: Saudi Arabia tops global ranking for women empowerment in AI
articles.author: The Siasat Daily
articles.summary: The Kingdom of Saudi Arabia has been ranked first globally for empowering women in artificial intelligence. This is according to the AI Index Report 2025 by Stanford University's Institute for Human-Centred Artificial Intelligence.       .   for gender inclusion in technology.

articles.title: Infosys' Nandan Nilekani: Indians 'Need not lose sleep' over developing large AI models like China's DeepSeek, as ...
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Nandan Nilekani is the co-founder of Infosys and architect of Aadhar. He says India is now focused on scaling up its national AI initiatives. He believes India has not yet developed large-scale AI, but its AI mission is active and the focus must shift to scaling it up.

articles.title: AI and data models opening new opportunities as Kickfurther grows
articles.author: The Buffalo News
articles.summary: Kickfurther CEO Sean De Clercq was skeptical about artificial intelligence at first. He is now more optimistic about it than before.   Â. Â   .      in this article. For more information on Kickfurther, visit their website.

articles.title: US Education Secretary Linda McMahon makes a 'Saucy AI Blunder' at education summit, sauce brand Kraft Heinz responds
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Linda McMahon confused artificial intelligence (AI) with A1 during a panel on educational innovation at the ASU+GSV Summit. She initially used the term AI correctly, but she later confused it with the popular steak sauce A1, according to USA Today.

articles.title: Dublin AI firm's new virtual changing-room tech takes fitting accuracy ‘to a new level'
articles.author: Irish Independent
articles.summary: Dublin artificial intelligence firm Swan AI plans to launch a new AI product in the near future. It will be called "Swan AI's AI Cloud" and it will be able to build its own AI systems. It is based in Dublin and has a team of around 100 people.

articles.title: Bugti urges AI use for better governance, youth development
articles.author: Dawn
articles.summary: Balochistan Chief Minister Sarfaraz Bugti stressed the importance of leveraging modern technology, particularly Artificial Intelligence (AI), to enhance transparency, efficiency and performance in governance, financial management and youth development initiatives. Bugti was chairing a high-level consultative.

articles.title: Learning Negotiation Skills Via Generative AI
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Negotiation is a tough sport. Generative AI stirs you to learn and greatly enhance your negotiation skills. Here are the best insights on how to do so.    .   and the best tips on how not to do it are: "Don't be afraid to try it".

articles.title: Investments in agentic AI assistants diversify Qatari economy, foster innovation
articles.author: The Peninsula
articles.summary: Investing in AI technology aligns with Qatar's strategic initiatives to diversify its economy and foster innovation. The Ministry of Communications and Information Technology's launching of the Artificial Intelligence Committee drives the. Qatar's substantial investments in AI and technology create a conducive environment for businesses to thrive.

articles.title: How AI is making self-appraisals better and less painful — for both workers and managers
articles.author: system
articles.summary: AI tools are increasingly used in self-appraisals to aid workers' evaluations of their performance. They can help address biases and subjectivity in traditional performance reviews. Human oversight is still crucial, but people tend to believe in it more than ever.

articles.title: AI humanoid robot learns to mimic human emotions and behavior
articles.author: Fox News
articles.summary: Disney Research has created an autonomous humanoid robot that can mimic human emotions. The robot can express emotions like shyness, excitement or friendliness. It is the latest creation of the innovation powerhouse behind The Walt Disney Company, Disney Research, which is based in California.

articles.title: There's a way to get all your favorite AI tools for life
articles.author: PC World
articles.summary: 1min.AI combines popular AI tools like GPT-4.0 and Midjourney and lifetime access is only $79.97. It's hard to get by without them now, but that doesn't mean you have to pay for them.

articles.title: AI unveils face of Jesus using 'Shroud of Turin': Can an algorithm reveal the ‘real' messiah?
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has created a photorealistic image of Jesus Christ based on the Shroud of Turin using the Midjourney platform. It is based on a model created by Midj Journey. It's based on an image created by an artificial intelligence.

articles.title: UN Input On AI: Winners, Losers, And Opportunities
articles.author: John Werner
articles.summary: The UN put out a report this year on artificial intelligence. It estimated AI will affect up to 40% of jobs globally and that it will be concentrated in a specific cluster of companies. The model provided estimates on the size of global leadership in AI funding, with the United States at $67 billion in private AI investment in 2023, China with $7.8 billion, and India with $1.4 billion.

articles.title: AI: Assistant Or Doppelgänger? Why Leaders Must Train AI—Not Become It
articles.author: Vibhas Ratanjee
articles.summary: In the age of generative AI, leaders are creating versions of themselves that operate without them. AI can help organize thoughts, but the voice, the energy behind the words, has to be yours. Many leaders struggle with authenticity, because they mirror what they believe leadership is supposed to look like.

articles.title: After Ghibli art trend, Barbie Box challenge breaks the internet: How to create your AI ...
articles.author: The Economic Times
articles.summary: The Barbie Box Challenge is a viral AI trend where users turn their photos into digital Barbie-style dolls using tools like ChatGPT and DALL-E. It is inspired by the popular series "Barbie Box" on "The Ellen DeGeneres Show".

articles.title: Poll Finds Americans Are Largely Disgusted by AI-Generated News
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: As news brands experiment with artificial intelligence in their content, readers remain unimpressed. Nearly half of the survey's respondents said they don't want AI reporting the news to them. 20 percent said they prefer news tools that allow readers to get information by chatting with a virtual assistant or digital chatbot.

articles.title: After Ghibli art trend, Barbie Box challenge breaks the internet: How to create your AI doll avatar?
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: The Barbie Box Challenge is a viral AI trend where users turn their photos into digital Barbie-style dolls using tools like ChatGPT and DALL-E. It is inspired by the popular series "Barbie Box" on "The Ellen DeGeneres Show".

articles.title: It's game over for people if AI gains legal personhood
articles.author: The Hill
articles.summary: The modern conversation about artificial intelligence often gets stuck on the wrong questions. As the technology accelerates, we risk missing the deeper, more urgent issue: the legalities of a giant automated dispatching machine controlled through clever programming optimizations like surge pricing. It's important to control it and to ensure it doesn't break free from human oversight.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence transforms patient care and reduces burnout, physician says
articles.author: Fox News
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is transforming how doctors interact with patients. Thousands of doctors across the country are using a form of AI called ambient, which is already in use in some doctor's offices and might be in use during your next visit to the doctor's office.

articles.title: AI redefines the education ecosystem
articles.author: Oman Observer
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) was not born yesterday. It all started in the 1950s with the work of Turing. AI is a machine's ability to exhibit intelligent behaviour. It's a state of the art technology that allows a machine to learn from human intelligence.

articles.title: 'Catastrophic overtraining' could harm large language AI models that are trained on more data for ...
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: Over training large language AI models resulted in worse performance, according to university researchers.       .   for training large AI models over time resulted in a worse performance. for training AI models. for more information, visit: http://www.univerities.org/research/over-training-large-language-ai-models.

articles.title: AI holds promise in scientific research, but can't substitute for humans, experts say
articles.author: Paige Gross
articles.summary: The Trump administration is making sweeping cuts to staff and research grants at science-related agencies. The National Institutes of Health, U.S. Centers for Disease Control and the Department of Health and Human Services have moved to cut thousands of jobs and billions in federal grants that fund university research and laboratory needs. The federal government may be eyeing artificial intelligence to bridge the gap created by these cuts. Last year's Nobel Prize in Chemistry was awarded to three scientists for discoveries that used AI to predict the shape of proteins and to invent new ones.
